item.title: About the project
item.description: This website is dedicated to my research project undertaken at the University of South Australia. I interview video game developers, asking them about the following things: how your leisure looks like, what activities you prefer, why they are valuable for you. Why is this important? Participation in a range of leisure activities contributes in different ways. Customising our free time, we can achieve more meaningful leisure experiences.

item.title: Researcher
item.description: Raman Voranau I have nearly a decade of experience in the cultural and creative industries. I worked in the museum of arts, event agency as well as in a not-for-profit organisation, where I administrated educational projects for the early career creative workers. In 2017–2018, I completed the MSc programme at the University of Glasgow, doing research about digital creative workers and their international mobility. Currently, I am engaged in Masters by Research course at the University of South Australia studying leisure experiences of the video game makers.
